name: World Play: Reading Toronto's Many Languages, Chapter 3
description:
Curated by Alon Nashman, celebrate Toronto's extraordinary linguistic and cultural diversity, a city where over 200 languages are spoken.

We invite audiences to experience a rich tapestry of voices through brief readings of poetry, theatre, fiction, philosophy, and song lyrics each read in its original language and accompanied by an English translation. Each evening will be dedicated to a theme around which all the readings will coalesce. The theme for this chapter is Light. 

We invite you to join us, whether as readers or listeners, on this immersive journey into phonaesthetics.

name: Beethoven and Reinecke
description:
Our first concert of the season celebrates the composers Beethoven and Reinecke. 

With the dramatic and powerful Beethoven's Overture zu Coriolan and Symphony No. 7 in A Major, contrasted with the sweeping harp of Carl Reinecke's Harp Concerto, this will be a sensational experience. 

Featuring harp soloist, Andrew Chan, this evening of live classical music will be sure to move you.

name: Forestry Talk at St. Lawrence Library
description:
Toronto has one of the largest urban forests in the world. Join City of Toronto Urban Forestry staff for an in-library presentation on this amazing natural habitat that reaches all corners of Toronto. We'll talk about what makes the urban forest so special and share tools to explore and understand it better. Bring questions and curiosities, and leave with emboldened confidence and understanding of your City and the natural world that surrounds you!

Registration is not required.

Toronto Public Library is committed to accessibility. Please call or email us if you are Deaf or have a disability and would like to request an accommodation to participate in this program. Please let us know as far in advance as possible, and we will do our best to meet your request. At least three weeks' notice is preferred. Phone (416) 393-7099 or email accessibleservices@tpl.ca

name: Holiday Harmonies
description:
Welcome to our annual holiday concert, our most festive performance of the year! 

This season is especially meaningful as we celebrate our first holiday program under the direction of our new conductor Tony Nguyen, whose fresh energy and vision have brought an exciting spark to the ensemble.

We're also delighted to feature special guest vocalist David Malcolm, whose rich voice and warm presence will bring an unforgettable touch to the night's program.

Join us for an evening of music, community, and seasonal magic!
